page.title: 05THE ECUMENICAL CENTRE
page.content: The Ecumenical Centre was opened in June 1985. It was designed to bring people together from different religions and social backgrounds through its function as a neighbourhood centre. Playgoups, community organisations, clubs, and socials are held here. It is also used for prayer and worship. In this capacity it is multi-denominational, embracing C of E, Baptists,Congregationalists, United Reformers, Methodists, and Free Church Christians. One part of the centre is always open for public prayer. Built at a cost of Â£320,000 and with a capacity of 250 people this is a very interesting fusion of religious and social life.
